text: The St. Joseph's Cathedral Cathedral of St. Joseph in Fort-Liberté () also called Fort-Liberté Cathedral is a religious building belonging to the Catholic Church and is located in the city of Fort-Liberté (freedom Fort or Fòlibète in Haitian Creole), capital of the northeastern department (Département Nord-Est) in the Caribbean country of Haiti. The temple follows the Roman or Latin Rite serves as the seat of the Bishop of the Diocese of Fort-Liberté (Latin: Dioecesis Castelli Libertatis). Work for its original construction was completed in 1703. It is under the pastoral responsibility of the Bishop Quesnel Alphonse. ==See also== *Roman Catholicism in Haiti *St. Joseph's Cathedral (disambiguation) ==References== Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Haiti Category:Fort-Liberté Category:Roman Catholic churches completed in 1703 Category:1703 establishments in the French colonial empire
title: St. Joseph's Cathedral, Fort-Liberté
